qas.question: What kind of treatment can be made to alter it's properties?
Softening metals can be achieved by?
Aluminium, copper, magnesium, titanium, and nickel can be strengthened by?
Annealling softens metals by achieving what?

answers.text: recrystallizes the alloy and repairs the defects

qas.question: what is made to stabalize the properties of base metals?
|Creating defects in what softens a metal?
What does annealing cause defects in?

context: <b4_0>Alloys<b4_0/> are often made to alter the mechanical properties of the base metal, to induce hardness, toughness, ductility, or other desired properties. Most metals and alloys can be work hardened by creating <b6_0>defects in their <b5_0><b8_0>crystal structure<b8_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/>. These defects are created during plastic deformation, such as hammering or bending, and are permanent unless the metal is recrystallized. However, some alloys can also have their properties altered by <a0_0>heat treatment<a0_0/>. <b7_0>Nearly all metals<b7_0/> can be softened by <a1_0>annealing<a1_0/>, which <a3_0>recrystallizes the alloy and repairs the defects<a3_0/>, but not as many can be hardened by controlled heating and cooling. Many alloys of aluminium, copper, magnesium, titanium, and nickel can be strengthened to some degree by some method of <a2_0>heat treatment<a2_0/>, but few respond to this to the same degree that steel does.
